intro: Cyclopogon calophyllus, commonly known as the velvetleaf cyclopogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Arecaceae family, which includes palms, and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clustered inflorescences. Cyclopogon calophyllus is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for tropical gardens and landscapes.
